name: 語意學專題討論
goals: introduces students to a wide range of semantic phenomena and issues in formal semantics, adopting a truth-conditional account of meaning.
syllabus:
**Course Description**

The objective of this course is two-fold: firstly to examine the relationship between meaning and logic and secondly to provide pre-QE students the opportunity to explore research topics of their interest (e.g., partitives in Portuguese). For the former, topics covered include propositional and predicate logic, semantic inference relations, GQT, and NP representations.

**Required Text**

A course reader provided by the instructor

(Rec.) L.T.F. Gamut, _Logic, Language, and Meaning_, University of Chicago Press

**Grading**

Midterm (25%); Final (25%); Attendance and participation (10%)

Assignments, incl. squib (20%); Article presentations (20%);

**Course Schedule (16 + 2)**

Week 1: Introduction & preliminaries

Week 2: Truth-conditional theory of meaning

Week 3: Propositional logic

Week 4: Logical equivalences

Week 5/6: Semantic inference

Week 7/8: \*Selected papers

Week 9: Midterm

Week 10: Predicate logic

Week 11: Generalized Quantifier Theory

Week 12/13: NP representations

Week 14/15: \*Selected papers

Week 16: Final

Flexible session: Moodle assignment
prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
